text: Park Man Bok (30 August 1936 in Seoul - 26 September 2019 in Lima) was a South Korean volleyball player and coach. He was elected to the Volleyball Hall of Fame. He studied at Kyung Hee University. From 1960 to 1964, he served in the Korean Army. From 1965 to 1968, he coached Soong Eui Women’s College. From 1969 to 1972, he coached the Korean Air team. He coached the South Korea women's national volleyball team at the 1973 FIVB Volleyball Women's World Cup. He coached the Peru national women’s volleyball team, at the 1974 FIVB Volleyball Women's World Championship, 1978 FIVB Volleyball Women's World Championship, 1982 FIVB Volleyball Women's World Championship, 1986 FIVB Volleyball Women's World Championship, 1990 FIVB Volleyball Women's World Championship, 1976 Summer Olympics, 1980 Summer Olympics, 1984 Summer Olympics, 1988 Summer Olympics, and 2000 Summer Olympics. == References == Category:1936 births Category:2019 deaths Category:South Korean volleyball players Category:Volleyball coaches
title: Park Man Bok
